alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 01 at 1:07PM PST until March 05 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 14 inches possible, and up to 2 feet over higher terrain. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of western and southern Siskiyou County, including Happy Camp, Mount Shasta City, Dunsmuir, and portions of Interstate 5, Highway 96, and Highway 89. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult to impossible. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
